title: Air Fryer Tilapia with Fresh Lemon Pepper Recipe
description: Cook tilapia in an air fryer with this quick and easy recipe that uses homemade lemon pepper to boost the flavor of this mild, white, and flaky fish.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Seafood Fish Tilapia Air Fryer Tilapia with Fresh Lemon Pepper 4.6 (14) 12 Reviews 3 Photos Cook tilapia in an air fryer with fresh lemon pepper to kick up the flavor. Although this fish is low carb and light, you won't be sacrificing flavor. Submitted by lutzflcat Updated on November 18, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 3 3 3 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 tilapia fillets Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 (6 ounce) tilapia fillets 2 tablespoons lemon zest 2 tablespoons olive oil 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 ½ teaspoons coarsely ground black peppercorns ½ teaspoon salt 1 pinch paprika, or to taste cooking spray 1 sprig parsley, chopped, or more to taste 4 wedges lemon Directions Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 3 minutes. Meanwhile, rinse tilapia fillets and pat dry with a paper towel. Mix together lemon zest, olive oil, garlic, pepper, and salt in a small bowl until well combined. Rub over tops of fillets, then sprinkle lightly with paprika. Lightly coat the air fryer basket with cooking spray. Arrange fillets evenly in the basket, spice-side up. Do not crowd; if needed, cook in batches. Cook in the preheated air fryer until fish flakes easily with a fork, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove fillets to a plate and garnish with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges. Recipe Tip Cook time will depend on the thickness of your fillets and the type of air fryer used. Add Your Photo Photos of Air Fryer Tilapia with Fresh Lemon Pepper 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  mcpatticakes 02/26/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Simple and easy. I loved it. Some changes. I'm not a huge pepper fan so I used a small amount of regular pepper. I also did not have fresh parsley so I used dried parsley. And I only use Grapeseed oil. 03 of 03 Photo by  lutzflcat 03/03/2021 1 You’ll Also Love Cajun Air Fryer Salmon 53 Ratings Lemon-Garlic Air Fryer Salmon 22 Ratings Pan-Fried Tilapia 12 Ratings Garlic Alfredo Tilapia 458 Ratings Pan-Grilled Tilapia with Lemon and Red Onion 6 Ratings Air Fryer Salmon Patties 9 Ratings Tilapia en Papillote (Tilapia in Parchment) 24 Ratings Air Fryer Lobster Tails with Lemon-Garlic Butter 52 Ratings Almond-Crusted Tilapia 513 Ratings Almond and Parmesan Crusted Tilapia 38 Ratings Keto Pecan-Crusted Pork Chops in the Air Fryer 8 Ratings Blackened Fish 286 Ratings Healthy Dijon Salmon for One 2 Ratings Coconut-Crusted Tilapia (Paleo) 27 Ratings Air Fryer Tilapia Milanese for Two 3 Ratings Air Fryer Fish Sticks 22 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: lutzflcat

Rub over tops of fillets, then sprinkle lightly with paprika. Lightly coat the air fryer basket with cooking spray. Arrange fillets evenly in the basket, spice-side up. Do not crowd; if needed, cook in batches.;Cook in the preheated air fryer until fish flakes easily with a fork, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove fillets to a plate and garnish with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.
